english: crude; blunt; State of Lu (ancient); surname

etymology.interpretation: Combines the fish component to signal the semantic category with the phonetic 卤/鹵 (lǔ) to indicate pronunciation. In later usage it names the State of Lu and appears in words meaning “crude; blunt,” with the phonetic element driving the reading.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing 魚 with its simplified form 鱼, reducing total strokes.

examples.chinese: 孔子是春秋时鲁国的人(孔子是春秋時魯國的人)。
examples.pinyin: Kǒngzǐ shì Chūnqiū shí Lǔguó de rén.
examples.english: Confucius was from the State of Lu in the Spring and Autumn period.

examples.chinese: 我们的同学姓鲁(我們的同學姓魯)。
